subject: Cooking
title: Pizza Dough: The 72-Hour Secret
description: A short lesson to help you apply Pizza Dough: The 72-Hour Secret.

hook.text: The best Neapolitan pizzerias ferment their dough for 72 hours. Fast-food chains use 2. You can taste the difference.

buildup.text: Extended fermentation allows enzymes to break down complex starches into simple sugars.

discovery.text: More available sugars mean better browning, more complex flavor, and a lighter, more digestible crust.

twist.text: Quick-rise pizza dough often causes bloating because unfermented starches are harder to digest.

climax.text: Neapolitan pizza's DOC certification requires specific fermentation times â€” quality is legally enforced.

punchline.text: The secret to great pizza isn't toppings. It's three days of patience.

quiz.question: Why does 72-hour fermented pizza dough taste better?
options: Enzymes break starches into sugars for better browning and flavor
